title: Boss of Scots Widows goes in Lloyds rejig
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Boss of Scots Widows goes in Lloyds rejig Toby Strauss has headed the insurance group for four years Peter Nicholls/The Times Katherine Griffiths Banking Editor Last updated at 12:01AM, October 2 2015 
The chief executive of Scottish Widows has left suddenly with no job to go to as Lloyds, its owner, is reorganising its businesses. 
Toby Strauss, who has headed the insurance group for four years, will be replaced on an interim basis by Antonio Lorenzo, who will add responsibility for running the division to his job as head of consumer finance at Lloyds. 
Mr Lorenzo is a close associate of António Horta-Osório, Lloyds’ chief executive, because they worked together at Santander. 
News of the reshuffle prompted speculation that Lloyds may reconsider whether to sell Scottish Widows, which it bought in 1999 Subscribe now
